name: DomiciliaryOrRestHomeProviderSupervisionServicesCPT
title: Domiciliary or Rest Home Provider Supervision Services (CPT)
description: This value set includes CPT codes for encounters for physician supervision of a patient who is either residing at home and receiving domiciliary care OR living in an assisted living facility.
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This set of values contains CPT codes for physician supervision of a patient who is either residing at home and receiving domiciliary care OR residing  in an assisted living facility. Physician supervision includes creating and updating care plans and the medical record; reviewing patient status and new clinical findings; and communicating with other healthcare professions and legal caregivers.),(Data Element Scope: The intent of this data element is to identify patients residing at home and receiving domiciliary or home care OR residing  in an assisted living facility for whom a physician supervision event occurs.),(Inclusion Criteria: Include physician supervision events for patients living at home and receiving domiciliary. Include physician supervision events for patients living in an assisted living facility.),(Exclusion Criteria: Exclude direct provider-patient encounters. Exclude patients living in a skilled nursing home, or patients receiving hospice care.)

concept.display: Individual physician supervision of a patient (patient not present) in home, domiciliary or rest home (eg, assisted living facility) requiring complex and multidisciplinary care modalities involving regular physician development and/or revision of care plans, review of subsequent reports of patient status, review of related laboratory and other studies, communication (including telephone calls) for purposes of assessment or care decisions with health care professional(s), family member(s), surrogate decision maker(s) (eg, legal guardian) and/or key caregiver(s) involved in patient's care, integration of new information into the medical treatment plan and/or adjustment of medical therapy, within a calendar month; 15-29 minutes

Individual physician supervision of a patient (patient not present) in home, domiciliary or rest home (eg, assisted living facility) requiring complex and multidisciplinary care modalities involving regular physician development and/or revision of care plans, review of subsequent reports of patient status, review of related laboratory and other studies, communication (including telephone calls) for purposes of assessment or care decisions with health care professional(s), family member(s), surrogate decision maker(s) (eg, legal guardian) and/or key caregiver(s) involved in patient's care, integration of new information into the medical treatment plan and/or adjustment of medical therapy, within a calendar month; 30 minutes or more
